alert.note: Alert for Benton; Buchanan; Cedar; Delaware; Iowa; Johnson; Jones; Keokuk; Linn; Louisa; Muscatine; Washington (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 20 at 12:45AM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Louisa, southern Buchanan, northeastern Keokuk, southwestern Cedar, Johnson, Benton, northern Washington, southwestern Jones, western Delaware, northwestern Muscatine, Linn and Iowa Counties through 130 AM CDT... At 1245 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near La Porte City to South English. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Mount Auburn around 1250 AM CDT. Brandon around 1255 AM CDT. Independence, Wellman and Rowley around 105 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Walker, Kalona, Winthrop, Quasqueton, Richmond, Troy Mills, Lone Tree, Riverside, Hills, Ryan and Masonville. This includes the following highways... Interstate 80 in Iowa between mile markers 212 and 253. Interstate 380 between mile markers 1 and 55. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 600 AM CDT for northeastern and east central Iowa.

area.areaDesc: Benton; Buchanan; Cedar; Delaware; Iowa; Johnson; Jones; Keokuk; Linn; Louisa; Muscatine; Washington
